lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Two rounds of talks between President Reagan and Nakasone, scheduled for Thursday and Friday, come on the heels of the imposition by the United States of punitive tariffs on Japanese goods for the first time since World War Two.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Mitsuru Uchida, professor of political science at Waseda University, told Reuters: "I doubt that whatever Nakasone does in Washington -- no matter how good it might be -- would help restore his weakened power-base at home."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The issues include foreign access to a new Japanese overseas telecommunications venture and a six billion dlr international airport project in western Japan.
